question_category.name: Default for AIET_Course1
question_category.info: The default category for questions shared in context 'AIET_Course1'.

question.name: Elements of a Career Pathway
question.questiontext: Elements of a Career Pathway (check all that apply)

answer.answertext: Industry Focus. Aligns with skill needs of industries in the state or regional economy.
Academic Prep. Prepares an individual to succeed in secondary or postsecondary education options.
Counseling & Guidance. Includes counseling to support an individual in achieving the individual's education and career goals.
IET. Includes, as appropriate, education offered concurrently with and in the same context as workforce preparation activities and training for a specific occupation or occupational cluster.

Accelerated Pace. Organizes education, training, and other services to meet the particular needs of an individual in a manner that accelerates the educational and career advancement of the individual to the extent practicable.
HSE & Credential. Enables an individual to attain a secondary school diploma or its recognized equivalent, and at least one recognized postsecondary credential.
answer.feedback: Another defining feature of a career pathway, according to WIOA, is that it enables an individual to attain a secondary school diploma, or recognized equivalent, and at least one recognized postsecondary credential. However, an IET, depending on what learners it is geared towards, may not culminate in a HSE or postsecondary credential. For example, the basic skills instruction may be for learners who are Pre-HSE or learning English.

answer.answertext: Occupation Emphasis. Helps an individual enter or advance within a specific occupation or occupational cluster.

question.name: Application Activity: Connecting to a Career Pathway
question.questiontext: After you have read this profile of an IET program: Addressing Cross-Industry Needs in a Rural Community, match the following components of a career pathway with the elements described in the program profile.

match.questiontext: The group identified an increased need and competition for boiler operators in manufacturing companies across the region IET

Together, we defined the initial steps along the boiler operator career pathway that would enable incumbent workers to quickly move up the progression and create openings and opportunities for others.

Our model focuses on the boiler operator training and the academic and work readiness supports that enable students to complete their high school equivalency while completing the training and secure employment.

The lesson plans we developed focused on applying an understanding of algebraic equations to boiler operation… We were also able to build in the skill of reading gauges for information necessary to fill in the variables in an equation.
We described the supports available to eligible participants for reducing their barriers to participation.
To advance along the boiler operator career pathway a participant must complete an approved boiler operator training course, followed by a three-month apprenticeship or OJT.
The next step is applying for and taking the Boiler Operator Exam for state licensing certification. With this license, the initial step in the career pathway is considered complete.

question.name: Collaboration
question.questiontext: I would need knowledge of or information about:

answer.answertext: contacts at our local workforce board
contacts at the local  American Job Center
contacts at companies in a high-growth industry sector
contacts at community-based human service and other organizations
contacts at career and technical education and workforce training providers
experience and skills in facilitating collaboration across multiple organizations

question.name: Intake and Orientation
question.questiontext: I would need knowledge of or information about:

answer.answertext: the opportunities for employment in the targeted career pathway
workforce preparation skills and personal attributes needed to be successful in the pathway
academic and language foundation needed to enroll in the IET
career interest and skill assessments to help applicants determine readiness and fit
day-to-day duties,  work environment, and training demands of the targeted occupation,  in order to help prospective students make informed decisions to participate in training
available resources to support the learner through the training
how to conduct a comprehensive intake interview to determine eligibility and fit
guest speakers to share information about workforce training and targeted career pathways

question.name: Curriculum and Instruction
question.questiontext: I would need knowledge of or information about:

answer.answertext: skills, interests, and personal attributes needed to be successful in the pathway
basic academic and language skills needed to succeed in training
curriculum used in the workforce training component
models and practices for working in coordination with workforce training instructors to support participants
contextualizing basic skills instruction
authentic workplace scenarios and problems for the application of basic skills

question.name: Using Data for Continuing Improvement
question.questiontext: I would need knowledge of or information about:

answer.answertext: best practices for gathering feedback from students via surveys, focus groups, and interviews
best practices for gathering feedback from key workforce and employer partners
how to best use our state-reported data (e.g., student demographics, measurable skills gains, credential attainment, attendance, persistence, etc.  to inform program improvement)
types of additional data we might collect and use to evaluate our program and inform improvements
understanding who is responsible to take action or make changes given the data

question.name: Wrap-around Services and Career Support
question.questiontext: I would need knowledge of or information about:

answer.answertext: supports available at the local  American Job Center
services and supports available at local community-based human service and other organizations
best practices for assisting students with career exploration and planning
best practices for assessing student eligibility for services and financial support related to training participation
local employment opportunities in the targeted occupation

question.name: Essay response
question.questiontext: Now that you have considered how you would contribute to an IET program, which of the key elements do you have the most checks under? What are two steps you can take to become more knowledgeable in this area?

question.name: The definition of Integrated Education and Training is outlined in which federal legislation?
question.questiontext: The definition of Integrated Education and Training is outlined in which federal legislation?

answer.answertext: Every Student Succeeds Act (ESSA)
Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA)
Carl D. Perkins Act

question.name: A key feature of an IET program is the integration of three core curricular components. Which list is correct?
question.questiontext: A key feature of an IET program is the integration of three core curricular components.  Which list is correct?

answer.answertext: High school equivilancy preparation, English instruction, workforce training
workforce preparation activities, adult education and literacy/basic skills, workforce training
workforce preparation, employability skills, career pathways

question.name: A benefit of IET to adult learners is that it:
question.questiontext: A benefit of IET to adult learners is that it:
question.generalfeedback: Although counseling and support are not in the definition of an IET, remember that an IET should be part of a career pathway that includes counseling and support.

answer.answertext: Is not focused on preparing learners for a specific industry or occupation
Enables accelerated learning and reduces the training time

question.name: Which of the following best illustrates the concept of three curricular components being taught concurrently?
question.questiontext: Which of the following best illustrates the concept of three curricular components being taught concurrently?

answer.answertext: Over the 18-week program, welding classes are every afternoon, Mon - Fri. Basic skills are taught in the evenings on Mon and Tues. On Wed evening, students learn how to write resumes, search for jobs and practice interviewing for jobs.

During weeks one through eight students attend basic skills classes, Mon - Fri.  Welding classes are taught weeks eight through sixteen and students look for jobs during the last two weeks. The total program is 18 weeks long.
Throughout the 18-week welding program,  students work with a career counselor to learn how to write a resume. The career counselor runs workshops on resume writing and job search skills.

question.name: Which of the following best illustrates the concept of basic skills instruction contextualized to a specific industry or occupation?
question.questiontext: Which of the following best illustrates the concept of basic skills instruction contextualized to a specific industry or occupation?

answer.answertext: An adult education instructor uses a high school equivalency test preparation textbook and practice tests to teach the basic skills portion of a manufacturing IET because a high school credential is required by local manufacturing companies.

An adult education instructor spends an hour each day in the carpentry shop identifying the reading and math used in the class and in textbooks to inform the planning of the content and application activities of the basic skills class.

question.name: A program that prepares students to pass a high school equivalency exam while simultaneously helping them explore career options and research local training programs is an example of an IET.
question.questiontext: A program that prepares students to pass a high school equivalency exam while simultaneously helping them explore career options and research local training programs is an example of an IET.
question.generalfeedback: Although the program might help students explore career options and research future training, it does not provide workforce training, a key feature of an IET.

question.name: Every step of IET planning, design, and implementation relies on collaboration.
question.questiontext:
Select the correct word from the drop-down menu to fill in the words in the sentences below.
 
Every step of IET planning, design, and implementation relies on [[1]] 
A comprehensive and holistic intake and [[2]] process is integral to supporting student success. 
Quality curriculum and instruction provide opportunities for students to apply and practice learning in [[3]] scenarios they would encounter in the [[4]]

question.name: Fill-in-the-blank (4.1.10)
question.questiontext:
Effective IET programs have a dedicated person who provides students with [[1]] and connection to [[2]] to help them stay on track with their goals.
Data used for continuous improvement include student outcomes such as the attainment of [[3]] and employment as well as [[4]] from students, instructors, and employers.

question.name: To show the sequence of the four phases of IET planning, match the phase number to the title.
question.questiontext: To show the sequence of the four phases of IET planning, match the Phase number to the title.
question.generalfeedback:
Phase 1  Research and Assess

Phase 2  Design and Plan

Phase 3  Develop and Implement

Phase 4  Evaluate and Improve

question.name: Which approach to curriculum development is suggested in the IET Toolkit?
question.questiontext: Which approach to curriculum development is suggested in the IET Toolkit?

answer.answertext: Begin by developing a new curriculum.
Begin by surveying students about their interests.
Begin with an existing occupational training curriculum.

question.name: Fill-in-the-blank (4.1.10)
question.questiontext:
Select the correct word from the drop-down menu to fill in the words in the sentences below.

Effective IET programs have a dedicated person who provides students with [[1]] and connection to [[2]] to help them stay on track with their goals. 

Data used for continuous improvement include student outcomes such as the attainment of  [[3]] and employment as well as [[4]] from students, instructors, and employers.
